canonical_explanation.text: Integers include all whole numbers and their negatives {...,-3,-2,-1,0,1,2,3,...}. Negative numbers represent values below zero like debt, temperature below freezing, or elevation below sea level. Integers can be represented on a number line, compared using < > =, and added or subtracted using rules based on their signs.
rules: Negative numbers are less than zero and positive numbers
On a number line, numbers increase from left to right
Adding a negative is the same as subtracting its positive equivalent
Subtracting a negative is the same as adding its positive equivalent
When adding integers with the same sign, add their values and keep the sign
When adding integers with different signs, subtract the smaller from larger and use the sign of the larger

questions.question_text: Which of the following situations is best represented by a negative number?

options.text: A height of 500 meters above sea level

questions.hint: Think about which situation represents something below zero or less than nothing.

questions.question_text: If sea level is represented by 0, how would you represent a location 250 meters below sea level?
questions.hint: Below zero is represented by negative numbers.

questions.question_text: On a number line, which number is located exactly halfway between -6 and 2?
questions.hint: Find the average of the two numbers.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following temperatures in ascending order: -5°C, 3°C, -10°C, 0°C, 7°C. Which is the correct order?
questions.hint: Remember that more negative numbers are smaller.

questions.question_text: What is the value of (-8) + 5?
questions.hint: Find the difference and use the sign of the number with larger absolute value.

questions.question_text: A man had ₹250 in his bank account. He withdrew ₹400. What is his new balance?
questions.hint: Withdrawal means subtraction. The answer can be negative if he withdrew more than he had.

questions.question_text: Starting from -3 on a number line, if you move 7 units to the right, where do you end up?
questions.hint: Moving right means adding, moving left means subtracting.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.hint: More negative numbers are smaller in value.
Two negatives make a positive when subtracting.

questions.question_text: On a number line, starting from 2, you move 5 units left and then 3 units right. What is your final position?
questions.hint: Left means subtract, right means add. Do operations step by step.

questions.question_text: If the temperature is 5°C above zero, it is represented as +5°C. If the temperature is 8°C below zero, it is represented as ___.
questions.hint: Below zero means negative.

questions.question_text: On a number line, zero separates positive numbers on the ___ and negative numbers on the ___.
questions.hint: Think about the standard layout of a number line.

questions.question_text: The integer that is greater than -7 but less than -5 is ___.
questions.hint: List the integers between -7 and -5.

questions.question_text: The sum of -18 and 25 is ___.
questions.hint: When signs differ, subtract and use the sign of the larger number.
Same signs: add the numbers and keep the sign.

questions.question_text: If you subtract -12 from 8, the result is ___.
questions.hint: Subtracting a negative means adding the positive equivalent.

questions.question_text: On a number line, moving to the right represents ___ and moving to the left represents ___.
questions.hint: Think about which direction increases and which decreases.

questions.question_text: Starting from -4 on a number line and moving 9 units to the right gives you ___.
questions.hint: Moving right means adding.

questions.question_text: A submarine is at a depth of 450 meters below sea level. This depth can be represented as ___ meters.
questions.hint: Below sea level means negative.

questions.question_text: The smallest integer among -3, 0, -8, 5, and -1 is ___.
questions.hint: The most negative number is the smallest.

questions.question_text: Negative numbers are always used to represent losses, debts, or values below a reference point like zero.
questions.hint: Think about what negative numbers represent in daily life.

questions.question_text: On a number line, -5 is located to the right of -2.
questions.hint: Smaller numbers are to the left on a number line.

questions.question_text: Every negative integer is less than every positive integer.
questions.hint: Compare any negative number with any positive number.
More negative means smaller in value.

questions.question_text: The sum of two negative integers is always a negative integer.
questions.hint: Think about adding -3 and -5.

questions.question_text: Subtracting a negative number is the same as adding its positive equivalent.
questions.hint: Think about what happens with two negative signs.
Opposites cancel each other out.

questions.question_text: On a number line, to represent the addition of -3 and 5, you start at -3 and move 5 units to the left.
questions.hint: Adding positive means moving right, not left.

questions.question_text: Zero is neither positive nor negative.
questions.hint: Think about the special nature of zero.

questions.question_text: To subtract 6 from -2 on a number line, you start at -2 and move 6 units to the left.
questions.hint: Subtraction means moving left.

questions.question_text: Match the real-life situations with their integer representations.
questions.hint: Gain/above → positive; loss/below → negative.

questions.question_text: Match each integer with its position relative to zero on a number line.
questions.hint: Negative → left, positive → right, zero → center.

questions.question_text: Match each comparison with the correct symbol.
questions.hint: More negative is smaller; positive is always greater than negative.

questions.question_text: Match each addition problem with its answer.
questions.hint: Apply integer addition rules.

questions.question_text: Match each subtraction problem with its answer.
questions.hint: Remember: subtracting a negative equals adding a positive.

questions.question_text: Match the number line movement with the operation.
questions.hint: Right = add, left = subtract.

questions.question_text: Match the temperature with its comparison to 0°C.
questions.hint: 0°C is freezing; negative is below, positive is above.

questions.question_text: Match the starting point and movement with the final position on a number line.
questions.hint: Calculate the final position by adding (right) or subtracting (left).

questions.question_text: Match the set of integers with their arrangement in ascending order.
questions.hint: Arrange from most negative to most positive.

questions.question_text: Match each word problem with its integer expression.
questions.hint: Identify what is negative and what is positive in each situation.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following integers in ascending order (from smallest to largest).
questions.hint: Start with the most negative number and end with the most positive.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following integers in descending order (from largest to smallest).
questions.hint: Start with the largest (most positive) and end with the smallest (most negative).

questions.question_text: Five cities recorded the following temperatures: Mumbai 28°C, Delhi -2°C, Shimla -8°C, Bangalore 18°C, Srinagar -5°C. Arrange the cities from coldest to warmest.
questions.hint: Order the temperatures from lowest to highest.

questions.question_text: Starting from 0 on a number line, arrange the following movements in the order they should be performed to reach -7: Move 3 left, Move 5 right, Move 9 left.
questions.hint: Try different sequences to see which one ends at -7.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following expressions in ascending order of their values: (-5) + 8, (-3) - 4, 6 + (-10), (-2) + (-3).
questions.hint: First calculate each expression, then arrange the results.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following positions on a number line from left to right: 4, -6, 0, -2, 5.
questions.hint: Left to right on a number line is the same as smallest to largest.

questions.question_text: A business had the following monthly results: January: -₹5000 (loss), February: ₹3000 (profit), March: -₹2000 (loss), April: ₹8000 (profit), May: 0 (break-even). Arrange the months from worst to best performance.
questions.hint: Order the amounts from most negative to most positive.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following steps to solve (-8) - (-5) + 3 in the correct order.
questions.hint: Follow the order of operations, simplifying from left to right.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following steps to represent 5 - 8 on a number line in the correct order.
ordering_items: Start at 5 on the number line
questions.hint: Subtraction means moving left from the starting point.
correct_answer: Start at 5 on the number line

questions.question_text: Arrange the following scenarios in order from most negative to most positive value: 50m above sea level, 30m below sea level, sea level, 100m below sea level, 80m above sea level.
questions.hint: Below sea level is negative, sea level is 0, above sea level is positive.
